snippet: Detectives on two coasts scoured for evidence and a motive after Brandon Lincoln Woodard, a law student from Los Angeles, was stalked and killed in Midtown Manhattan.
abstract: Detectives in New York and California scour for evidence and a motive after Brandon Lincoln Woodard, a law student from Los Angeles, is stalked and shot to death in Midtown Manhattan; he was the scion of a successful California family, whose life had been a blend of achievement and puzzling setbacks that according to police included at least 20 arrests, mostly in California.

byline.original: By J. DAVID GOODMAN, SERGE F. KOVALESKI and WENDY RUDERMAN
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Jack Begg, Sheelagh McNeill and William K. Rashbaum in New York and Noah Gilbert in Los Angeles.

lead_paragraph: Detectives on two coasts scoured for evidence and a motive after Brandon Lincoln Woodard, a law student from Los Angeles, was stalked and killed in Midtown Manhattan.

headline.seo: Police on Two Coasts Seek Motive After a Midtown Execution
headline.main: Tracing a Victim’s Path in Life to a Brazen Killing in Midtown
headline.print_headline: Tracing a Victim’s Path in Life To a Brazen Killing in Midtown
